title: Nigeria in talks with Boko Haram about a possible ceasefire - government
text: March 25, 2018 / 3:08 PM / Updated 9 minutes ago Nigeria in talks with Boko Haram about a possible ceasefire - government Reuters Staff 1 Min Read ABUJA (Reuters) - Nigeria’s government is in talks with Islamist militant group Boko Haram about a possible ceasefire and the talks have gone on for some time, the information minister said on Sunday. FILE PHOTO: A Nigerien soldier walks out of a house that residents say a Boko Haram militant had forcefully seized and occupied in Damasak March 24, 2015. REUTERS/Joe Penney/File Photo “Unknown to many, we have been in wider cessation-of-hostility talks with the insurgents for some time now,” said Lai Mohammed in a statement emailed to Reuters about the background to the release on Wednesday of more than 100 schoolgirls that the group abducted last month. Reporting by Felix Onuah; Writing by Alexis Akwagyiram; Editing by Matthew Mpoke Bigg
